gcci.text: At $3.18/hr for H100, tight chip supply and high utilization are pushing GPU capex and lead times higher, amplifying downstream API pricing pressures.

gtpi.text: Input pricing at $1.25/1M tokens reflects intensifying API price wars and forces providers to double down on efficiency (quantization, MoE, caching) to protect margins.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load signals mounting grid strain and rising carbon footprint, driving carbon-aware scheduling and accelerated nuclear procurement.

aipi.text: The AI industry is optimistic but fragile: token compression, GPU constraints, and capex cycles create bubble risk; growth is sustainable only with higher utilization and model efficiency.
